title: Quick Guide to start & develop a green team
summary: Comprehensive 3-step guide for establishing and managing corporate green teams, covering setup, communication strategies, and practical implementation tips for sustainable business transformation.
structure: 3-step framework: Setting up, Communication, Getting started

why_questions: Define Green Team vision and missions aligned with business direction
Define mission statement and focus areas
what_questions: Define roadmap with goals, priorities and actions
Define clear and understandable KPIs with regular reporting
how_questions: Find Executive sponsor for visibility and engagement
Determine budget requirements and project funding
who_questions: Define participant roles (leader, sponsor, contributors, consultants, PMs, influencers)
Include various profiles from different departments (Tech, Creative, Finance, HR, Sales)
when_questions: Agree on time commitment and cadence
Have 1 person officially dedicating time (others 1-2 hours/week)

communication_levels: Internal events for awareness and engagement
engagement_categories: I play my part: recycling, stationary amnesty

communicate: Quarterly meetings for wins and next steps
collaborate_engage: Ideation contests with funding for winning projects
walk_the_talk: Use office as lab for best practices
Create green zones with recycling bins
Provide ceramic mugs and branded tumblers
Calculate and reduce office energy consumption

time_commitment: 1-2 hours per week average, with 1 person dedicating official time
additional_resources: Green Harvard - 10 tips for successful green team

authors.name: Claire Kolly
authors.title: Director, HR Consulting & Executive Coaching, EDLT.global

authors.name: Mary Kon-Sun-Tack
authors.title: Asia Customer Experience Director, Sustainability Ambassador, Lyreco

target_audience: Companies wanting to establish internal sustainability teams
